page.title: 16Creca Village
page.content: The village has one main street. Most of the houses are re-conditioned old cottages. There are two new houses. There is a village hall, a telephone box and a Post box. A small industrial estate lies to the east of the village. There is a sawmill, pipe factory, concrete manufacturers and a garden centre. Most people in Creca are employed at Chapel Cross Nuclear Power station or are farmworkers. There is a W.I. which uses the village hall. Beech Hill farm lies to the west of the village. It is a mixed stock farm. Grass is cut for silage and a little barley is grown for stock feed. Extensive drainage has been carried out as the land ajoining Creca Moss is wet. Stock is mainly beef cattle and breeding ewes.
